column4: Does anyone know why a gateway pentium D computer will not run a live cd? I put a new cmos battery in it, changed cd drives, safe graphics mode, alterenate iso, usb boot, and both 64 and 32 bit installs. It either says: boot error. or reboots when it starts loading the kernal? I have never seen anything like it...
hmm, memory? md5sum the iso image?
new and old
btw, pentium D doesn't support 64bit if I remember correctly.
they ahve worked on other computers and I have checked them
memory? it has a gig, but  I dont remember the brands.
So you do you even see the bootloader splash screen when booting from the live cd?

yes, it comes up and askes if it want to try  or intall ubuntu etc. If I try or intstall it spins teh cd up and then reboots. I have played with the bios too. I have tried this with new and old versions of (x/u/k)buntu
Have you run memtest86 from the cd?
I'd run that. just to rule out your memory
ok, any other ideas?
hmm, reset bios back to defaults.
are the cables on the cdrom new or old?
old
do you have any newer ones? I'd also try replacing that.
if i put a new battery in wouldnt that reset teh bios?
no
ok
usually you have a jumper on the MB that you can use to reset the BIOS back to factory defaults
ya ok
Try the BIOS reset first, then try installing, if that fails, run the memtest, if that fails, replace the cdrom cable.
if that all fails... dude I'm sorry... I'm out of ideas atm
i can try other ram perhaps. thanks man
ok good luck... =)
